snippet: Housing starts in June jumped 9.8 percent, spurred by a 28.6 percent surge in multifamily housing that put apartment construction at its highest rate since November 1987.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports that new housing construction in June 2015 rose 9.8 percent to seasonally adjusted 1.17 million homes, indication that economic growth is beginning to permeate lagging home construction industry.
lead_paragraph: Housing starts in June jumped 9.8 percent, spurred by a 28.6 percent surge in multifamily housing that put apartment construction at its highest rate since November 1987.

headline.main: Housing Starts Soar, Driven by Gains in Apartments
headline.print_headline: Building of Apartments Sends Housing Starts Up
